column4: Hi all, I hope someone can help me... I have a fresh Gutsy install, and apt-got Thunderbird. But after starting, the app just dies on me, without reason. Does anyone know what I should do?
did you try running from a terminal and see if it spits out any error messages?
no errors.., ends with  /usr/lib/thuderbird/components/libcommandlines.so (loading of it)
this is a completely fresh install?
meaning that there is no .thunderbird settings directory or something similar hanging around?
with updates untill yesterday, yes. At least system wise, installed a couple of other apps, which have no connection to moz or otherwise
ok, well i think you are stuck doind a backtrace. use gdb to get a bt
k, can you point me to howto's?
just man gdb or search google, gdb backtrace
are you sure, there's no .mozilla dir? if there is, try deleting that first and start tbird
backup the dir first of course :)
delete those after backing up to some other filename
and then try to start it
something might be corrupt in there
any luck with that thunderbird issue?
